intro: Gymnolomia villosa, commonly known as the hairy gymnolomia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Gymnolomia villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
